newsitem.title: USA: Duke halts Oconee 2 power plant restart.
newsitem.headline: Duke halts Oconee 2 power plant restart.

text.p: Duke Power Co halted restart of its 846 megawatt (MW) Oconee 2 nuclear power plant after a heater drain pipe ruptured, injuring seven workers, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) reported Wednesday.
The plant, in Seneca, S.C., was being restarted at the time of the mishap after shutting Monday to repair a valve.
The plant was back on the grid and producing at about 60 percent of its rated capacity when the pipe ruptured.
The NRC said the injured workers had been taken to a local medical facility for treatment but did not give the extent of their injuries.
No estimated restart date was given for the unit, which was listed by the NRC as being in "hot shutdown."
The company was not immediately available for comment.
Neigboring Oconee units 1 and 3, also rated at 846 MW, continued to operate at full capacity. All three units are fully owned by Duke.
Duke Power Co is based in Charlotte, N.C.
